sentences: Olen siis kaome eestlane. (I am then a proud Estonian.)
Kas sa oled kaome ja tänaseks? (Are you proud and for today?)
Tema oli alati kaome oma tegude üle. (He was always proud of his actions.)
context: The word 'kaome' in Estonian translates to 'proud' in English. It is used to describe a feeling of pride, either about oneself or something one is associated with.
